title: Kyogle, NSW car crash: One man dead, three other motorcyclists injured
text:
One motorcyclist was killed and three other riders seriously injured after a head-on crash with a car in northern NSW.

Emergency services were called to Summerland Way near Runnymede Rd at Kyogle on Sunday afternoon after reports of a collision between a Kia Rio travelling north and four motorcycles travelling south.

The riders were four men aged in their 50s.

One of them, believed to be a 55-year-old, was critically injured in the crash at about 1.45pm and died at the scene.

Another rider, aged 56, suffered serious injuries and was taken to Lismore Base Hospital.

From there, he was flown to Gold Coast University Hospital in a serious but stable condition.

Police said the other two riders, aged 52 and 53, suffered serious injuries and were taken to hospital for treatment.

The driver of the red Kia Rio, a 52-year-old man, was trapped in the vehicle for a short time.

He was released and also taken to hospital for treatment and mandatory testing.

Crash investigators have examined the scene and inquiries continue.

A report will be prepared for the coroner.
description: One motorcyclist was killed and three other riders seriously injured after a head-on crash with a car in northern NSW.
